sections.name: session-trial
sections.definition: Session-trial-template template schema generated by the CEDAR Template Editor 2.6.56

sections.name: in2pb-header
sections.definition: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.

properties.name: in2pb-header
properties.definition: Header to be used for metadata templates created for In2PB projects.

sections.name: session-trial-header
sections.definition: Header with instructions for the sessions and trial metadata.

properties.name: session-trial-header
properties.definition: Header with instructions for the sessions and trial metadata.

sections.name: session-element
sections.definition: A non-intermittent period in which the subject is in the experiment room. Note that in an ephys context a session often corresponds to a day of recording, but in certain cases, several sessions can occur during a single day - the session id must be chosen to gaurantee its uniqueness.

properties.name: sessionID
properties.definition: A session is defined as the continuous time block between when the first data point is recorded after the subject is brought in and when the subject leaves. The sessionID is a unique identifier which should match the “ses-<label>” used in file naming system.

properties.name: sessionStartDateTime
properties.definition: Date and time of start of session. This should correspond to the first date time when the first data point of the session was recorded.

properties.name: sessionDuration
properties.definition: The total duration of the session.

properties.name: sessionQuality
properties.definition: A general rating of the quality of the session to simplify data screenings for further analyses.

properties.name: sessionDataQuality
properties.definition: A general rating of the quality of the primary data signals.

properties.name: trialCount
properties.definition: Total number of trials within a session.

properties.name: trialDefinition
properties.definition: A free text space to provide the unambiguous description of what does a trial correspond to in the described session.

sections.name: trial-element
sections.definition: A trial is defined as a single performance of a given task or a single presentation of a stimulus.

properties.name: sessionID
properties.definition: Session identifier in which the trial being described occurs.

properties.name: trialID
properties.definition: Unique identifier associated with each trial.

properties.name: trialTimeStamp
properties.definition: Timestamp associated with the start of the trial.

properties.name: trialEndStamp
properties.definition: Timestamp associated with the end of the trial.

properties.name: trialType
properties.definition: Referemce to the trial type to be used.

sections.name: free-text-field
sections.definition: A free text element to allow the user to provide any additional information.

properties.name: free-text-field
properties.definition: A free text element to allow the user to provide any additional information.
